news.title: Deftones announce Dublin summer gig with special guests IDLES
news.summary: They will play the Irish Museum of Modern Art on August 25.

news.title: Michael Bublé announces summer gigs in Dublin, Limerick and Belfast
news.summary: He will play Malahide Castle on June 27, Thomond Park Stadium on June 28 and Belsonic on July 1.

news.title: NSOI: Bill Whelan at 75 at The National Concert Hall (Photos)
Reggae pioneer Jimmy Cliff dies aged 81
news.summary: Tributes have been pouring in for the musician who brought reggae music to the global stage.

news.title: James Taylor announces Cork and Dublin shows
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale Friday, November 28 at 10am.

news.title: Johnny Marr announces Dublin show
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale Friday, November 28 at 10am.

news.title: Guns N' Roses announce 3Arena tour date
The Shows Must Go On - November's best TV: The Death of Bunny Munro, Pluribus, The Beast In Me and more
news.summary: From Nick Cave-inspired dramedy and Cold War criminal capers to bonkers sci-fi yarns and nasty neighbour nailbiters, STUART CLARK will be glued to his TV this month.

news.title: McNeill's: "We're just guardians of this pub... You have to make sure you preserve it the best you can, and hand it over to whoever else is coming behind you"
news.summary: McNeill's on Capel Street is considered one of Dublin’s finest spots for a pint by locals and visitors to the city alike. From its famous open fires, to its traditional music sessions every night of the week, we delve into the pub's fascinating history. We look back to its roots as a 19th century music shop.

news.title: Joanne McNally set to be first Irish female comedian to headline 3Arena
news.summary: Tickets go on sale later this week.
